question.title: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: n must be positive in deck class

node.contents: @HaydenHolligan For example you could always remove the first item (`remove(0)`), until the deck is empty. As a separate comment, have you considered using a LinkedList instead of an ArrayList? It has a `removeFirst` and `removeLast` methods and could be more efficient for your use case.

node.contents: It seems there is other code we might need to see, but my guess is `PlayerCardDraw()` is being called too many times, emptying out `cards` and causing `0` to be sent to `nextInt()`.

node.contents: You might be calling PlayerCardDraw method even before a card is added to the list. Means cards.size() must be returning a zero. So it is illegal to generate a random int using a zero seed. Hence is the error.

astNode.text: You might be calling PlayerCardDraw method even before a card is added to the list. Means cards.size() must be returning a zero. So it is illegal to generate a random int using a zero seed. Hence is the error.

node.contents: I found where that should be happening and I edited my question and posted the code there. It's running a for statement that only runs 4 times, it should reset at 53, not 4 right?

astNode.text: I found where that should be happening and I edited my question and posted the code there. It's running a for statement that only runs 4 times, it should reset at 53, not 4 right?

node.contents: My guess is that you keep calling PlayerCardDraw more than 52 times. Each time, a card is removed from the deck, so the 53:d time, you are trying to draw a card from an empty deck (ie. a deck of size 0) which causes generator.nextInt(cards.size()); to throw an exception.

astNode.text: My guess is that you keep calling PlayerCardDraw more than 52 times. Each time, a card is removed from the deck, so the 53:d time, you are trying to draw a card from an empty deck (ie. a deck of size 0) which causes generator.nextInt(cards.size()); to throw an exception.

node.contents: However it is not easy to say. When you are having problems like this and want help, always show the full stack trace of the exception. Also, since we cannot see line numbers in code on stackoverflow, be sure to indicate in the code exactly at which line the exception occurs.

node.contents: @HaydenHolligan I would suggest you add a print statement to you `playerCardDraw()` method, just for the purpose of debugging. Add `System.out.println("playerCardDraw() was called. There are now " + cards.size() + " cards left in the deck.");` If, as expected, the number of calls to the method is unexpected, also add a line saying `new Exception().printStackTrace(System.out);` Right after the previous debug statement. This way, you can tell from where the method was called.

astNode.text: @HaydenHolligan I would suggest you add a print statement to you `playerCardDraw()` method, just for the purpose of debugging. Add `System.out.println("playerCardDraw() was called. There are now " + cards.size() + " cards left in the deck.");` If, as expected, the number of calls to the method is unexpected, also add a line saying `new Exception().printStackTrace(System.out);` Right after the previous debug statement. This way, you can tell from where the method was called.

node.contents: Well looking at your Deck class, You have intialized cards in constructor so there should not be such an exception(as cards size is 52).

astNode.text: Well looking at your Deck class, You have intialized cards in constructor so there should not be such an exception(as cards size is 52).

node.contents: But one thing is possible to get an exception which is cards is declared public and you may have modified it outside class directly. So arraylist cards is of size 0 and you get IllegalArgumentException exception for your method Random.nextInt(int).

astNode.text: But one thing is possible to get an exception which is cards is declared public and you may have modified it outside class directly. So arraylist cards is of size 0 and you get IllegalArgumentException exception for your method Random.nextInt(int).

node.contents: Make cards private.

astNode.text: Make cards private.

node.contents: If you have withdrawn all cards then size of arraylist would become 0, which may cause an exception. Add check for 0 as :

astNode.text: If you have withdrawn all cards then size of arraylist would become 0, which may cause an exception. Add check for 0 as :

elements.contents: public Card PlayerCardDraw () { Random generator = new Random (); if(cards.size() > 0) { int index = generator.nextInt (cards.size()); return cards.remove (index); } else { return null; } }

units.rawText: public Card PlayerCardDraw () { Random generator = new Random (); if(cards.size() > 0) { int index = generator.nextInt (cards.size()); return cards.remove (index); } else { return null; } }
